reviewText: Is  very amazing, I never believed it until I bought it.  When I get home, my food is ready.  It really works, I guarantee it 100%
exceeded expectations and used daily

reviewTitle: Amazing! Also love the connected feature!
reviewText: This thing works as advertised. Just remember: Instant pots cut down on the cooking time. They don't do a thing for the preparation time! If it takes you half an hour to cut up your veggies or cut up you meat or whatever, that will still take a half an hour! But we love our Instant Pot! In my opinion the food just tastes better. Chicken might be a bit on the rubbery side (that's over stating it) but the flavors that come out are amazing. An unexpected benefit.As to the WiFi piece and the app: I have mixed feelings. First of all, it works. It's great to just have the Instant Pot sending me messages like when it changes modes or if there's a problem or how much time is left. That part works great and I love it for that alone. Everything else we control from the front panel of the device so I don't really care about how much control I have of the Instant Pot from my phone. You're trying to save time. Digging out your phone, opening the app, finding the right part of the app to set this up uses up more time. What's the point?!I as well as many others recommend this version of the Instant Pot.

I've wanted an instant pot for over a year, and finally decided it was time. The wifi version has been worth every penny. The phone on what's going on have made me so much more willing to cook, knowing I wont forget my food and overcook it, or forget there next step. And because it's wifi and not Bluetooth, it doesn't drain my phone.

after 2 weeks of use, my Instant pot is not warming any more in any of his functions.The wifi connection was never working despite a 2.4 ghz connection..the Amazon seller does not organize a return after one month delivery and the manufacturer warranty does not apply either on Instantpot.com. Nobody is taking responsibility for the deffective item.A total waste of money

reviewTitle: Release the pressure before taking off the lid
reviewText: I had one but got one for my son and daughter-in-law, and they love it also

is it ok to say I am not in love with my instant pot?? i have cooked pot roast & stew in it. The meat came out flavorless. Yes, it cooked in a lot less time than on the stove top, but, the flavor was sacrificed.
The only thing that would make this better... if I had chosen to buy a larger capacity unit.  Other wise... I LOVE this machine!!!
I absolutely love this instant pot, it‚Äôs a definitely a smart cooker. It tells you on your phone when your food need to be stirred and when it‚Äôs burning. A must have.
Instructions could be a little more clear.

Everything i expected and more!  Works great!  My favorite is steel cut oats.  Usually takes 30 minutes on the stove (of stirring... and more stirring...)  Now, it takes 15 minutes total and they come out perfect every time!  That's just one example.
Easy to use simple cooking.Have not got WiFi feature to work but haven‚Äôt tried again.
Easy to use, good size

reviewTitle: You will wonder how you made it this far without instant pot.
reviewText: Best tool in my kitchen.  So many things to make and cook fast.
I love my Instapot!  It‚Äôs easy to use and easy to clean.
Love everything about it. Makes making meals so much easier and faster!
Works Good and wi-fi works good

reviewTitle: The wifi works great every time and is very useful.
reviewText: I do my Instant Pot cooking downstairs from my living area. I used to setup a camera to keep an eye on things. Now I just load up the pot, put the lid on and enter all the settings  on my iPad or phone. The app will tell me when the pressure starts and ends and I can watch for burn warnings.
does everything great - nice and heavy duty Cooks like a charm

reviewTitle: For the foodie that's also a techie
reviewText: There might be cheaper pressure cookers, but this is the one to get if you want to control your pressure cooker with a phone app. Did I pay a $50 premium to use my phone to start cooking? Yes. Yes I did. But the best thing about the instant pot is the saut√© feature, which allows me to brown meat and saut√© onions straight in the pot, which also allows it to get up to pressure temp faster. And since I love cooking and braising meats that usually take hours on the stove, this one is a huge time saver.
Wife loves it!
Enjoy not being in the same room with the instant pot. Communicates well. Made rice well. Bone soup well. Ribs turned out great.
Only used it a few times so far but it‚Äôs amazing. I can even control it with my phone.
Love it
It‚Äôs just ok for me

I have had the Instant Pot Duo for some time now. after I dropped and dented it, my dog got ahold of the valve and then I melted the handle on the stove, I decided to buy a new one. I‚Äôm a tech geek, so I bought the WiFi model. Set up was pretty easy but the valve is really touchy. It doesn‚Äôt really work unless I stand over it (hello, no benefits to WiFi).  Then, I se up first meal. Chicken noodle soup. I used a recipe in the app - tried to cook and it said it wasn‚Äôt connected. Fail. Couldn‚Äôt get it connected. I‚Äôll keep trying but you might want to stick with a basic model.
Ease of use is simple. Food tastes awesome.

Error C6 after according to a month of use. It's  a bad pressure sensor. The device is therefore unusable. Do not recommend this product.Also, be aware of the product's limited warranty, which only applies in the United States and Canada. This information was never specified during the order.I ordered this product in December 2018 and Amazon delivered it to me without any problem in the French West Indies. I paid more for shipping than for product. Unfortunately 30 days later it does not work anymore, so it's a great product. Not living in the coverage area, so I can not do anything. This is scam because today, coincidentally, Amazon no longer delivers my geographical area.

reviewTitle: Que llegue a tiempo y en buenas condiciones
reviewText: Muy buen producto

Using this is so easy. There are tons of places online to get different recipes and having control from my phone is a great bonus. You can take a 3-4 lb roast that has been in a deep freeze set at 0F and have it fork tender in just over 2 hours. That's not + thaw time. That is straight from the freezer into the pot and only adding some liquid as a base.
Worst piece of junk on the market. WIFI didn't work. Called tech support for help and tried unsuccessfully to get it to work.
Nice but a little hard to use

This is one of the best investments I ever made.  I use it 2 x day.  I stopped using the stove and the oven.  I cook everything in in the Instapot.  Plus I save time. For example, I can have Baked Potatoes in 20 minutes.

This is a wonderful addition to my kitchen and helped delete a couple. This isn't you mother or grandmother's pressure cooker. It is far easier to use, doesn't 'blow up' and is really easy to clean. One pan for saute, cook and keep warm. It is also the steamer and slow cooker. Granted, you can't do two things at once so a little planning is required. Most of the time listed for prep is longer, but I am slow. I liked it so well, gave one our daughter. She likes being able to get the meal on the table in just a short time. There are lots of recipes out there on the internet so buying a cookbook is only needed if you really want the book. You can find and some conversion instructions there as well. The timer let's you set up a time delay for the slow  cooker part. You can go from frozen to cooked as well.  I have had no problems with it.
WiFi isn‚Äôt so good
Just get it
Cook

Received Instant Pot as a gift. For me it works best with soups and curries. Does an excellent job with the frying of onions, spices, etc. and then moves into the final stages all in one pot.Now if that was it I'd be a happy camper. The SS pot is not easy to get properly clean. It seems modern day made in China stainless steel isn't the same quality as my old SS pots. The old ones clean up easily whereas these pots remain stained unless you scrub with Barkeepers Friend or similar and then rinse and soap off the reside that the BKF leaves behind. Dishwasher just makes it all worse.
Thing drops from a standard 2.4GHZ all the time. The app is useless. Do yourself a favor and look at other pressure cookers.
The wireless feature is incredibly easy to use and integrated well with the app

Cooks super fastTakes some getting used too on how to use had to watch some YouTube videos directions are not goodWish I wouldn‚Äôt have bought the smart oneI don‚Äôt care for the WiFi it cooks so fast you really never leave it un attended couldn‚Äôt even connect it because it needs the WiFi to run a specific way to connect so I just didn‚Äôt bother

reviewTitle: I am a sucker for bells and whistles, but glad I got this one with WIFI
reviewText: I love this cooker and especially like the WIFI connection.  I do not have to hang around waiting to be sure it is heating up properly and I like being alerted when it is done.  I have cooked a dozen meals already and it is so easy and so fast.  Love the saut√© feature, and the high sides of the pot keep splashing to a minimum.  I did immediately purchase a steam diverter and an accessory kit and I am happy with those purchases as well, they should be included with the IP, although some people might not be as adventurous a cook as I am.

reviewTitle: Safe if you read the instructions.
reviewText: Controls can be confesing at first.

I have just set up and tested my smart pot.  It took several tries to get it to connect to wifi.  The thing that shocked me is the fact that there is no digital readout of temperature.  You actually have to open the pot and check the temperature with a manual thermometer.  I can‚Äôt imagine why they wouldn‚Äôt have included that feature since it would be so easy to add it.  All you get is a cartoon thermometer, with no calibrations, showing a red line that goes up and down with temperature.
I really enjoy this product. My only issue is that I wish there was an ability to select the desired temperature. At the very least, I should be able to view it...

reviewTitle: I like it for some things
reviewText: I like this for certain things - like soup, or chicken.  But I'm finding I don't like the taste of beef when I cook it in the Instant Pot....maybe I'm doing something wrong.  I'll stick to slow cooking or using my stove top and oven for beef.

reviewTitle: Instant food just the way I like it
reviewText: I asked my wife what she thought and she said 'mmm I love my instapot more than my hubby'

reviewTitle: Nice device and works well but have not seen the benefits of the wifi
reviewText: I do like the speed to prepare meals, the size if good for a family of four but I really can not see the need for the wifi if you use the pressure cooker because it prepares meals minutes.  Seems sold and well build but only time will tell how it hold up.
Quick delivery and product as advertised.
Works great love it

This is an amazing purchase. My wife loves this thing.Bluetooth is a little wonky, but who cares - you may use that once or twice and then the new is worn off.On the other hand, since Christmas, this has become a major appliance never leaving the countertop and is used almost daily.
Love the simplicity and ease of use. Fairly easy to clean but does require some scrubbing.
I haven‚Äôt used it however looks nice. I‚Äôm excited about learning how to use it.

reviewTitle: Not as impressive as I'd hoped
reviewText: WiFi was hard to set up - didn't work as expected and the tech support had very limited hours. When I did get in touch it took her several tried and 30 minutes to get it set up.  I tried a couple of recipes and found that food stuck whether on pressure cook or slow cook.  It seemed like it would have been just as easy to cook stovetop and/or in the oven.  I really want to love it but. . .

Ok, this thing is fanstastic for making tender meats and rice very quickly. Do I use it every day? No. Could I live without it? Yup. It‚Äôs a nice product but a little overhyped, I feel. The WiFi feature is a dud, no biggie. It‚Äôs a pressure cooker, no better than any other pressure cooker; I got caught up in the hype wave and while I don‚Äôt regret my purchase, I probably wouldn‚Äôt buy this again. It takes up a lot of kitchen space for something I use every couple of weeks, if that.
I love how fast I can make dinners!!!
